metadata.title: CVE-2014-125024 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in FFmpeg 2.0. It has been rated as critical.Affected by this issue is the function lag_decode_frame. The manipulationleads to memory corruption. The attack may be launched remotely. It isrecommended to apply a patch to fix this issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-125024` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libavcodec58 - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libavdevice58 - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libavfilter7 - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libavformat58 - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libavresample4 - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libavutil56 - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libpostproc55 - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libswresample3 - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libswscale5 - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1').
